definitions: fundamental principle of cosmic order in Hindu and Buddhist philosophy
righteous way of living according to divine or natural law
examples: Following dharma leads to spiritual growth and enlightenment
The ancient texts emphasize dharma as essential to society
Each person must discover their own dharma through reflection
Living according to dharma brings harmony to one's existence

definitions: scattered population whose origin lies in a different geographic locale
dispersion of people from their ancestral or traditional homeland
examples: The Jewish diaspora has maintained cultural identity for millennia
African diaspora communities preserve their heritage through generations
The digital age creates new forms of diaspora connections
Many nations have significant diaspora populations contributing economically

definitions: mischievous or capricious act often done for amusement
legendary founder and queen of Carthage in classical mythology
examples: The children's didos kept their parents constantly alert
His latest dido involved hiding all the office supplies
Dido's tragic love story with Aeneas inspired countless artworks
The opera about Queen Dido remains popular after centuries

definitions: petroleum-based fuel used in compression-ignition engines
internal combustion engine that operates using diesel fuel
Italian fashion brand known for denim and casual wear
examples: Diesel fuel costs fluctuate with global oil prices
The truck requires diesel instead of regular gasoline
Modern diesel engines are more efficient than older models
The ship's diesel engine powers its transatlantic journeys
She bought new jeans from the Diesel store downtown
Diesel's latest collection features sustainable fashion materials

definitions: tangy prepared mustard originating from Dijon, France
historic city in eastern France known for mustard production
examples: The sandwich needs more Dijon mustard for proper flavor
Dijon mustard pairs perfectly with grilled meats and cheeses
Dijon attracts tourists interested in culinary history and architecture
The mustard makers of Dijon maintain centuries-old traditions

definitions: long-handled cup or ladle for transferring liquids
star formation visible in northern hemisphere also called Ursa
aquatic songbird that feeds by diving into fast-flowing streams
examples: Use the dipper to serve soup from the large pot
The water dipper hung beside the old well pump
The Big Dipper points toward the North Star reliably
Children learn to identify the Little Dipper constellation early
The dipper bird walks underwater searching for aquatic insects
American dippers nest behind waterfalls in mountain streams

definitions: deity or supernatural being associated with worship and religion
sacred knowledge or truth revealed through spiritual means
examples: Ancient cultures worshipped the divine through elaborate rituals
Mystics seek direct experience of the divine through meditation
The prophet claimed to receive the divine through visions
Sacred texts contain the divine wisdom of generations

definitions: early style of jazz music originating in New Orleans
informal term for the southern United States, especially former Confederate states
examples: The band played traditional Dixieland jazz at the festival
Dixieland music features collective improvisation and syncopated rhythms
Songs about Dixieland often romanticize the antebellum South
The term Dixieland carries complex historical and cultural meanings

definitions: informal term for doctor or physician
computer file format for word processing documents
examples: The doc said my ankle should heal within six weeks
Ask the doc about possible side effects of medication
Save the report as a doc file for editing later
The doc format ensures compatibility across different systems

definitions: United States Department of Defense responsible for military and national security
examples: The DOD announced new military procurement policies yesterday
DOD contractors must meet strict security clearance requirements

definitions: United States Department of Justice responsible for law enforcement and legal affairs
examples: The DOJ filed antitrust charges against the technology company
DOJ prosecutors handle federal criminal cases across the nation

definitions: United States Department of Labor overseeing workplace standards and employment
examples: The DOL released new workplace safety regulations this quarter
DOL statistics show unemployment rates declining across most sectors

definitions: small round mark or spot used in writing or design
Department of Transportation managing infrastructure and transit systems
examples: Place a dot at the end of each sentence
The map shows cities as dots of varying sizes
The DOT approved funding for highway bridge repairs
State DOT officials inspect roads for winter weather damage

definitions: licensed professional who practices medicine and treats patients
highest academic degree awarded by universities in various fields
person who alters or falsifies something, especially documents
examples: The doctor examined the patient's symptoms before prescribing treatment
Family doctors provide primary healthcare to their communities
She earned her doctor of philosophy in molecular biology
The doctor of education degree requires extensive research
The mechanic can doctor the engine to improve performance
Someone tried to doctor the financial records before audit

definitions: sound recording and reproduction technology company known for noise reduction systems
examples: The theater features Dolby Atmos surround sound technology
Dolby noise reduction improves audio quality in recordings

definitions: supreme authority or power to govern and control
territory or sphere of influence under particular rule or control
examples: The empire exercised dominion over vast territories for centuries
Parents have legal dominion over their minor children's affairs
Canada was formerly a dominion of the British Empire
The company expanded its dominion into emerging markets

definitions: rectangular tile marked with dots used in the game dominoes
situation where one event causes a series of similar events
small mask covering the eyes worn at masquerades
examples: Each domino has between zero and six dots on each half
The children enjoyed setting up dominoes to knock down
The bank failure created a domino effect throughout the economy
One resignation triggered a domino reaction in the department
She wore an elegant domino mask to the carnival ball
The domino concealed her identity at the masquerade party

definitions: complete destruction or killing of a group, population, or species
professional removal or killing of pests from buildings or areas
examples: The extermination of certain species threatens ecosystem balance globally
Historical records document the attempted extermination of indigenous peoples
The building requires professional extermination of the termite infestation
Regular extermination services prevent pest problems in restaurants

definitions: professional who eliminates pests such as insects or rodents from buildings
examples: The exterminator inspected the house for signs of infestation
We called an exterminator to deal with the ant problem

definitions: outer surface or part of something visible from outside
factor or influence coming from outside a system or organization
examples: The external walls need repainting after winter weather damage
Check all external connections before starting the computer
External pressures forced the company to change its policies
The audit focused on external threats to data security

definitions: permanent disappearance of a species when the last member dies
process of eliminating or extinguishing something completely
examples: Climate change accelerates the extinction of vulnerable species worldwide
The dinosaur extinction occurred approximately sixty-five million years ago
The extinction of certain traditions concerns cultural preservationists greatly
Behavioral extinction involves removing reinforcement from unwanted actions

definitions: portable device containing chemicals to put out small fires
examples: Every kitchen should have a fire extinguisher readily accessible
The extinguisher must be inspected and maintained annually

definitions: obtaining money or property through force, threats, or abuse of authority
examples: The businessman faced extortion charges for threatening his competitors
Police investigated the extortion scheme targeting local shop owners

definitions: something additional or more than usual or expected
person hired to appear in crowd scenes in films
special edition of a newspaper covering breaking news
examples: The meal comes with extras like dessert and coffee
Pack extra batteries for the camping trip this weekend
The film hired hundreds of extras for the battle scene
Working as an extra provides insight into movie production
The newspaper published an extra about the election results
Street vendors sold extras announcing the historic peace treaty

definitions: concentrated substance obtained by removing water or other diluting agent
passage or segment taken from a larger text or work
examples: Vanilla extract adds rich flavor to baked goods naturally
The herbal extract contains concentrated medicinal compounds
The essay includes extracts from several historical documents
Read this extract to understand the author's main argument

definitions: process of removing or obtaining something from a particular source
person's ethnic origin or ancestry
examples: Tooth extraction requires careful technique to prevent complications
Oil extraction methods have become increasingly sophisticated technologically
Citizens of Irish extraction celebrate their heritage annually
Her extraction traces back to nobility in Eastern Europe

definitions: machine or tool designed to remove or extract substances or objects
examples: The juice extractor processes whole fruits into healthy beverages
Use a nail extractor to remove embedded nails safely

definitions: legal process of returning accused or convicted persons between jurisdictions
examples: The extradition treaty allows countries to prosecute international criminals
Lawyers fought the extradition request for their client unsuccessfully

definitions: estimation of values beyond known data using patterns and trends
examples: Statistical extrapolation predicted population growth for the next decade
The scientist's extrapolation from limited data proved remarkably accurate

definitions: hypothetical or fictional being originating from outside Earth's atmosphere
examples: Scientists search for evidence of extraterrestrial life using radio telescopes
The movie features extraterrestrials visiting Earth from distant galaxies

definitions: lack of restraint in spending money or using resources
elaborate or excessive display, behavior, or decoration
examples: Their extravagance led to serious financial problems eventually
The wedding's extravagance impressed guests but strained the budget
The palace's extravagance reflected the monarch's unlimited power
Fashion shows often feature extravagance to capture media attention

definitions: elaborate and spectacular entertainment or production featuring varied performances
examples: The circus extravaganza featured acrobats, animals, and amazing stunts
Broadway's newest extravaganza combines music, dance, and visual effects

definitions: personality characteristic involving sociability, assertiveness, and positive emotionality
examples: High extraversion correlates with leadership roles in organizations
Psychological tests measure extraversion along with other personality dimensions

definitions: outermost or furthest point or limit of something
highest or most intense degree of a quality or condition
examples: The hikers reached the extreme edge of the cliff
Temperature extremes damage sensitive electronic equipment
The athlete pushes her body to extremes during training
Political extremes rarely represent mainstream public opinion

definitions: advocacy of extreme political or religious views and measures
examples: Extremism threatens democratic societies through violence and intolerance
Educational programs aim to prevent youth extremism and radicalization

definitions: person who holds extreme political or religious views
examples: Security forces monitor extremist groups for potential threats
The extremist refused to consider moderate political solutions

definitions: limb of the body, especially hands and feet
furthest point or limit of something
extreme degree of adversity or desperate situation
examples: Frostbite often affects extremities like fingers and toes first
Blood circulation to extremities decreases in cold weather
The explorers reached the northern extremity of the continent
The garden extends to the extremity of the property
In extremity, people discover reserves of unexpected strength
The extremity of their poverty moved charitable donors

definitions: quality of being full of energy, excitement, and cheerfulness
examples: Children's natural exuberance brightens any classroom environment significantly
The team's exuberance after winning was contagious and uplifting

definitions: organ of sight that detects light and enables vision
center of a storm or cyclone where conditions are calm
small loop or hole through which thread or rope passes
examples: The human eye can distinguish millions of different colors
Eye examinations detect vision problems and health conditions
Hurricane hunters fly through the eye to measure storm intensity
The eye of the storm passed directly over the island
Thread the needle by passing thread through its eye
The eye of the hook needs to be large enough

definitions: spherical structure of the eye contained within the socket
rough visual assessment or estimate without precise measurement
examples: The eyeball is protected by the eyelid and socket
Sudden pressure changes can damage the delicate eyeball structure
Just eyeball the measurements for this informal project
The contractor eyeballed the dimensions before formal surveying

definitions: strip of hair growing above the eye on the brow ridge
examples: She raised her eyebrow skeptically at the unlikely explanation
Eyebrow threading is a popular grooming technique in salons

definitions: movable fold of skin that covers and protects the eye
examples: The eyelid blinks automatically to keep eyes moist
Heavy eyelids indicate fatigue and need for sleep

definitions: lens or lens system nearest the eye in optical instruments
examples: Adjust the microscope eyepiece for comfortable viewing distance
The telescope's eyepiece magnifies the image for observation

definitions: person's ability to see and quality of vision
examples: Regular checkups help maintain good eyesight throughout life
His eyesight deteriorated gradually with advancing age

definitions: something very ugly or unpleasant to look at
examples: The abandoned building became an eyesore in the neighborhood
Residents complained the billboard was an eyesore blocking views

definitions: short story with animals as characters conveying a moral lesson
fictitious narrative or statement, especially one intended to deceive
examples: Aesop's fables teach timeless lessons through animal characters
The fable of the tortoise and hare illustrates persistence
His alibi turned out to be a complete fable
Don't believe the fables spread by unreliable sources

definitions: cloth produced by weaving, knitting, or felting fibers
basic structure underlying a system, concept, or society
examples: The designer selected luxurious fabrics for the evening gowns
Cotton fabric breathes better than synthetic materials
Trust forms the fabric of all healthy relationships
Immigration has always been part of America's social fabric

definitions: process of constructing or manufacturing something from components
invention of false information or creation of fictitious accounts
examples: Metal fabrication requires specialized tools and skilled workers
The fabrication plant produces components for aerospace industry
The witness admitted his testimony was complete fabrication
Media outlets retracted the story after discovering its fabrication

definitions: principal front face of a building facing a street
outward appearance maintained to conceal less pleasant reality
examples: The building's ornate facade features carved stone details
Architects preserved the historic facade during renovation
His cheerful facade concealed deep personal struggles
The company maintained a facade of success despite losses

definitions: front part of the head containing eyes, nose, and mouth
surface of something, especially the front or visible side
public image or reputation of a person or organization
examples: She washed her face with gentle cleansing products daily
Facial recognition technology identifies individual faces accurately
The clock face showed the time was nearly midnight
The north face of the mountain presents climbing challenges
The scandal caused the company to lose face internationally
Saving face is important in many Asian cultures
